title: Adrenaline Junkie Weekend
suitableFor: Experienced hikers and thrill-seekers comfortable with heights and exposed terrain. Must have a good level of fitness and be prepared for challenging conditions.
notSuitableFor: Those with a fear of heights, limited fitness, or no prior hiking experience. Young children and those with pre-existing medical conditions should avoid this itinerary.

stops.title: Velocity 2 Zip Line
stops.description: Experience Europe's fastest zip line at Penrhyn Quarry, reaching speeds of over 100mph.

wetAlt.title: Bounce Below
wetAlt.description: Underground trampoline adventure in a disused slate mine - fun whatever the weather.

budgetAlt.title: Zip World Fforest Coaster
budgetAlt.description: Ride the UK's only alpine coaster located in the beautiful forest in Betws-y-Coed.

stops.title: Pete's Eats
stops.description: A legendary mountaineering cafe in Llanberis, famous for its enormous portions and hearty fare.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Ogwen
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your sandwiches with stunning views of Tryfan and the Glyderau mountains.

stops.title: Crib Goch Guided Walk
stops.description: A challenging and exposed scramble across Crib Goch, one of Snowdonia's most iconic ridges, with expert guidance.
stops.travelToNext: 15min drive via A4086 and A498 to Nant Peris

wetAlt.title: Rock Climbing Taster
wetAlt.description: Learn the ropes indoors at Plas y Brenin National Mountain Sports Centre

budgetAlt.title: Snowdon Summit Hike (Llanberis Path)
budgetAlt.description: Hike to the summit of Snowdon via the Llanberis Path. Less exposed than Crib Goch, but still a challenging climb.

stops.title: Ben's Bunkhouse
stops.description: A comfortable and affordable bunkhouse in Nant Peris, perfectly located for exploring Snowdonia.
stops.travelToNext: 35min drive via A4086 and A5 to Bala

budgetAlt.title: The Snowdon Inn (Y Fricsan)
budgetAlt.description: Camping at the foot of Snowdon in Llanberis

stops.title: White Water Rafting
stops.description: Experience the thrill of white water rafting on the River Tryweryn at the National White Water Centre.

wetAlt.title: N/A
wetAlt.description: This activity is already weather-dependent and typically runs in most conditions. If conditions are *too* extreme, you'll get a refund.

budgetAlt.title: Gorge Walking
budgetAlt.description: Scramble up a mountain stream with Adventure Britain, jumping into pools and sliding down waterfalls.

stops.title: Riverside Cafe, Bala
stops.description: A casual cafe on the banks of the River Dee serving sandwiches, salads and hot meals.
stops.travelToNext: 10min drive via B4403 to start of mountain biking trails

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch by Bala Lake
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your lunch with scenic views of Bala Lake (Llyn Tegid).

stops.title: Mountain Biking - Temtiwr
stops.description: Tackle the 'Temtiwr' black graded trail at Coed y Brenin, a short but challenging route for experienced mountain bikers.

wetAlt.title: N/A
wetAlt.description: Head to the visitor centre for a hot drink and to dry off! Or try another trail.

budgetAlt.title: Mountain Biking - MinorTaur
budgetAlt.description: Explore the family-friendly 'MinorTaur' trail at Coed y Brenin, a blue graded route suitable for all abilities.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Snowdonia weather is notoriously unpredictable. Be prepared for all conditions, even in summer. Check the forecast before you go and pack accordingly.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy, especially during peak season and on weekends. Allow extra time for travel, particularly around popular areas like Llanberis and Betws-y-Coed. Parking at Pen-y-Pass is limited and fills up early - arrive before 8am or use the park-and-ride from Llanberis.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for Zip World activities and recommended for guided walks and white water rafting. Book accommodation well in advance, especially during school holidays.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary requires a high level of fitness and experience in challenging terrain. Crib Goch is a serious undertaking and should only be attempted by experienced hikers in good conditions.
